snippet: While supporters herald President Obama’s plan to extend preschool, critics argue that providing universal access could result in federal money being squandered on ineffective programs.
abstract: Pres Obama’s call in his State of the Union address for plan to extend preschool to all 4-year-olds is hailed by advocates who say inequity in education begins at a very young age; critics argue that providing universal access could result in federal money being squandered on ineffective programs.

byline.contributor: Meggan Haller contributed reporting from Mobile, Ala.

lead_paragraph: While supporters herald President Obama’s plan to extend preschool, critics argue that providing universal access could result in federal money being squandered on ineffective programs.

headline.seo: Early Education Far Short of Goal in Obama Speech
headline.main: Few States Look to Extend Preschool to All 4-Year-Olds
headline.print_headline: Few States Look to Extend Preschool to All 4-Year-Olds
